Class NativeTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Task
      • NativeTask

  • public class NativeTask
extends Task
    Class NativeTask lets the Parallel Java 2 (PJ2) middleware run a non-PJ2 executable program as a PJ2 Task. If the PJ2 Tracker daemon is present, the non-PJ2 executable program will run via the Tracker's job queue.

    Usage: java pj2 [ pj2_options ] NativeTask executable [ args ... ]

    Refer to the pj2 launcher program's documentation for descriptions of the pj2_options that may be specified; such as cores for the number of CPU cores required, gpus for the number of GPU accelerators required, timelimit for a time limit on the program run, debug to turn on various debug flags, and others.

    executable is the full path name of the executable program to be run, followed by the command line arguments for that program if any.

    In the executable program's environment, certain environment variables are set, as follows. For further information, refer to class Task's documentation.

      •   PJ2_THREADS = the task's threads() property
      •   PJ2_ACTUAL_THREADS = the task's actualThreads() property
      •   PJ2_CORES = the task's cores() property
      •   PJ2_GPUS = the task's gpus() property
